headline: Jarrad Branthwaite breaks silence on Man Utd transfer offers after Leny Yoro move
body: Manchester United had made Jarrad Branthwaite one of their top summer targets but appear to have moved on from the defender after Everton rejected two bids for him
Jarrad Branthwaite has insisted his full focus is on Everton having seen the Toffees reject two bids from Manchester United for him.

The Red Devils made the defender one of their top targets for the summer transfer window after an impressive debut campaign at Goodison Park. The 22-year-old won Everton’s Players’ Player of the Season and Young Player of the Season after his starring performances.

Those displays attracted the eye of United, who have prioritised signing defenders this summer. But the Premier League giants were twice rebuffed by Everton, who value Branthwaite at between £70million and £80million.

United were only willing to go as high as £46m though and appear to have now turned to secondary target Leny Yoro. The 18-year-old has had a medical at Old Trafford, with Branthwaite now brushing off any suggestion he will leave Everton this summer.

“I think for me it's just about taking what I learned from last season, and the season before, and putting it all together. I think last season, playing all the games I did helped me put performances in and get the experience I needed," he told Everton's club website.

"I'm going to take that into this season and keep learning. When you’ve got a good defensive record, it gives you confidence going into the new season. It’s not just the defenders who contribute to that, it’s the whole team.

"And it’s the way the manager has us set up to give us the best possible chance to win games, and to pick up as many points as we can. I think it’ll be the same again this season. Hopefully, we can pick up a few wins early on and get the momentum going in the new season.

“I think for any young person, any young player, it's about playing as many games as you can and that gives you the experience you need. You can only get experience in games and taking that into each game that I've done last season. It helped me massively to put in the performances which I did."

As well as the interest from United, Branthwaite's performances earned him his first England cap. And he is now looking to build on his appearance in the 3-0 win over Bosnia & Herzegovina under the Three Lions' next boss.

"I think you’ve got to be confident in your ability, but it's the best league in the world. It's got the best players and it's obviously the most difficult league in the world, so you know the expectations you're going to have," he added.

“It’s a dream come true. I think for any young kids, growing up, to represent their country is the main objective. For me to able to do that – with my family there, as well – it was massive. Not just for me, but for all of my family and friends, as well. It was a great experience.

“I want to play for England as many times as I can. It’s about putting in performances for club out there for whoever the next England manager is going to be, and to impress them. Hopefully, I get many more opportunities.”

headline: Louis van Gaal's blunt reaction speaks volumes as Man Utd make Matthijs de Ligt U-turn
body: When Matthijs de Ligt was first linked with a move to Manchester United, Louis van Gaal's thinly-veiled reaction to those initial links spoke volumes
Former Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal once urged Matthijs de Ligt to snub a move to Old Trafford - five years before the Red Devils flirted with signing him again.

United recently agreed personal terms with the central defender, which would have seen the 24-year-old ignore the advice from the manager he played under with the Netherlands. He appeared to be Erik ten Hag's preferred choice to fill the void left by the departing Raphael Varane.

However, the Red Devils' interest in the 24-year-old has cooled after they completed a medical for 18-year-old defensive prospect Leny Yoro, ahead of a £58m move. This has seemingly left De Ligt, who was benched by Eric Dier at Bayern Munich last season, in an awkward position, as it's unlikely United will shell out on another defender unless they sell any more of their current players.
Considering what has transpired the last few days, De Ligt may have been wishing that he followed Van Gaal's advice and steered completely clear of negotiating with United.

When United were first interested in De Ligt in 2019, Van Gaal listed three teams he should join instead, including the Red Devils' fierce rivals Manchester City. In an interview with Ziggo Sport, Van Gaal said: "De Ligt at Juventus? I think De Ligt can play in any competition.

"In Italy, they are the masters of defence, so he can best develop there. If I had the chance I would go to Barcelona. They have central defenders who are not too good, so he will play there. Or I would go to Manchester City. I don't think the central defenders are that great either, so he'll play there too."

Yoro will join Harry Maguire, Lisandro Martinez, Victor Lindelof and Jonny Evans in United's central defensive ranks. His arrival means they have now filled the hefty void departed by Varane, who left on a free transfer when his contract expired at the end of June.

When it comes to their backline, United are unlikely to add to it unless there are more outgoings. This is still a possibility as Maguire and Lindelof have been linked with moves away from Old Trafford.
The club are understood to be looking for a buyer for Linedlof, whose deal was extended by a year last season to stop him from leaving for nothing on June 30.

West Ham United have also previously expressed an interest in Maguire and are believed to be in discussions with the Red Devils about signing right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka. United have been one of the busier clubs so far in the transfer window.

They recently welcomed the £36.54m arrival of Bologna forward and young prospect Joshua Zirkzee. The Dutchman, who has two international caps for the Netherlands, both coming at Euro 2024, was recently announced by the club.

headline: Matthijs de Ligt still joins, Casemiro upgrade: Man Utd's perfect month before new season
body: Erik ten Hag is hoping Manchester United can enjoy a dream summer transfer window as he bids to revive his reign following a largely miserable second season in charge
Manchester United are hoping for a perfect summer window if Erik ten Hag is to revive his faltering reign.

Ten Hag endured a dreadful second season in charge last year and while he has been handed a new contract, the pressure is on for the Dutchman. United chiefs have already boosted their manager by signing Joshua Zirkzee.

The Netherlands international will battle it out with Rasmus Hojlund to lead the line in the Red Devils line-up. Ten Hag is also keen to add at least two more centre-backs to his squad and is still on the search for a replacement for Casemiro.

United's pre-season got off to a bad start with a defeat to Norwegian team Rosenborg and Ten Hag will be hoping the transfer window brings some much-needed positive news. Here, Mirror Football looks at how a perfect summer for United could play out.
15 July: Rosenborg 1-0 Man Utd
20 July: Rangers v Man Utd, Murrayfield, Edinburgh (16:00)
28 July : Man Utd v Arsenal, SoFi Stadium, Los Angeles (01:00)
2 August: Man Utd v Real Betis, Snapdragon Stadium, San Diego (03:00)
4 August: Man Utd v Liverpool, William-Brice Stadium, Columbia, South Carolina, (00:30)

United have been quick out of the blocks this summer, having already completed a move for top target Joshua Zirkzee. The Netherlands star impressed for Bologna last season and has signed for United in a deal worth £36million.
He will become the primary back-up for Rasmus Hojlund and will be looking to dislodge the Dane from the starting line-up. They are also set to announce the signing of Leny Yoro from Lille.

The 18-year-old has emerged as one of the top prospects in France and he comes in to boost Ten Hag's defensive options. The other piece of business completed has been the patching up of relations between Ten Hag and Jadon Sancho, with the winger now rejoining the first-team squad.

Dutch defender Matthijs de Ligt is still a United target, with Ten Hag desperate to bring his compatriot to Old Trafford. De Ligt has endured a few tough years, but played his best football under the current United boss at Ajax.
He would certainly be a major boost for United's defence and Bayern Munich appear ready to sell. But he'll only arrive if there are outgoings; however, don't bet against it.

The top target now is Manuel Ugarte, Paris Saint-Germain's Uruguayan midfield destroyer. He only joined PSG from Porto last summer but is available again, and United are very keen. The money for Mason Greenwood can go towards a deal for him, with Ugarte a like-for-like replacement for Casemiro, who struggled badly during United's difficult season last term.

The aforementioned Casemiro would likely head the list of those players departing Old Trafford. The Brazilian's career at the top level appears to be all but over, with Jamie Carragher just one pundit to urge him to move on.

Elsewhere, United are ready to sell Aaron Wan-Bissaka, with the Red Devils willing to accept a fee of just £15m for the right-back. Greenwood meanwhile is on his way to Marseille, with the Red Devils set to bring in a record profit for the striker.

Harry Maguire's time at United also appears to be over, with De Ligt and Yoro arriving and United ready to listen to bids for him. And they could also be tempted to allow Scott McTominay to depart, having already rejected at least one bid for him.

headline: Arsenal make Marc Guehi transfer U-turn after Crystal Palace demands emerge
body: Arsenal are among the top Premier League clubs who admire Marc Guehi, however, Crystal Palace's demands mean a deal for the coveted defender is unlikely to materialise
Arsenal have shelved interest in Marc Guehi with Crystal Palace demanding more than £70million for the England defender.
Guehi, 24, was one of the standout performers for England at Euro 2024 after being drafted into Gareth Southgate's starting XI and is admired by some of the Premier League's elite.

Both Liverpool and Manchester United have been credited with an interest in the centre-back's services throughout the summer - and it's now emerged that Arsenal were also mulling over a move for the Eagles' star defender. However, The Times notes that Arsenal have moved on to other targets after being priced out of a move for Guehi, who is valued in excess of £70m.

Palace are aware of interest in the defender and his stock is at an all-time high after his strong showing at the European Championship. But Chelsea are due 20 per cent of any future sale which has influenced the Eagles' demands.

While it remains to be seen if anybody will attempt to prise Guehi away from Crystal Palace this summer, Arsenal have turned their attention to Riccardo Calafiori. The Italy defender, 22, is capable of playing as either a centre-back or a left-back and was one of his country's top performers at Euro 2024.

Recent reports have indicated that Arsenal are in talks with Bologna over a deal for Calafiori. The Serie A outfit are also hampered, though, by a significant sell-on clause which would see the defender's former club, Basel, profit from any deal worth more than the £3.4m they banked when selling him last year.
With no deal in place between Arsenal and Bologna, Calafiori returned to pre-season training this week following a break after his Euro 2024 exploits.

Bologna have already sold one first-team star to a Premier League club this summer following Joshua Zirkzee's switch to Manchester United, but it's not thought that they would attempt to stand in Calafiori's way should Arsenal meet their demands - despite being able to offer Champions League football.

Arsenal have made just the one senior signing this summer, bringing David Raya back to the club on a permanent basis. A number of fringe players, including Eddie Nketiah, Emile Smith-Rowe and Reiss Nelson, have all been linked with moves away.

headline: Graeme Souness takes Paul Pogba stance with Kobbie Mainoo in repeat criticism
body: Graeme Souness has taken aim at Kobbie Mainoo as he highlighted flaws in his game whilst away with England - some of which he also criticised Paul Pogba for whilst at Manchester United
Graeme Souness' gripes with Paul Pogba seemed to rumble on for years - and now he's delivered similar criticism to Kobbie Mainoo.

Manchester United 's teenage sensation made his debut less than a year ago but has enjoyed a rapid rise, featuring in England's Euro campaign and scoring in the final of the FA Cup as the Red Devils claimed the trophy at Wembley.

Huge plaudits have come his way as he's defied his age and experience to influence games from the middle of the pitch. Mainoo started several games at this summer's Euros, including the final, but for the first time in his career has come in for criticism for his displays.
The United youngster was unable to help the Three Lions wrestle back control in some of their games this summer, notably in the final when the Spanish midfield dominated the contest in Berlin.
At such a tender age Mainoo has plenty still to learn but Souness has delivered him a reality check by admitting, off the ball, he seems to lack an awareness and portrays an element of naivety.

He said on the Up Front podcast : "I think he’s really good on the ball, he’s very talented on the ball, but he doesn’t fully understand the position. He wanders, he empties the middle of the field too readily. I watched him against Iceland [in England’s final Euro 2024 warm-up game] and he was getting thrown to the left and thrown to the right.

"He came on as a substitute when holding onto a 1-0 lead [in the Euro 2024 opener against Serbia] and the first thing he did was chase down the goalkeeper and try to put him under pressure. It’s naivety, he’s still learning the game."

Few expect Mainoo to be the finished article and his exploits thus far, particularly in Manchester, have marked him out as a generational talent and those at Old Trafford are ready to sit down and offer the teenager a new deal to tie him down long-term.

Another man those in Manchester thought was a future star was Pogba. They had the Frenchman as a teenager, before seeing him leave for Juventus. They believed so much in his talent though that they spent a club-record fee of £89million to bring him back in the summer of 2016.
Pogba's time at Old Trafford, which spanned six seasons, was categorised by moments of brilliance in a spell that ultimately failed to deliver as inconsistencies hampered the Frenchman.

Souness was among his most vocal of critics - with some of those now echoing what he's said about Mainoo. He previously commented on Pogba: "He has super individual ability - there is much to admire about his technique when he is on the ball and his general athleticism.

"But if I am playing today I want to play against him because he is never where he should be when I am in possession. The criticism I have is that he doesn't understand the role when not in possession. I don't see any changes in his play from the day he arrived to now. With all his attributes he should be a bigger goal threat."

headline: Manchester United overhaul continues with £83million transfers confirmed in next 24 hours
body: Man Utd's major squad overhaul has already seen the signing of forward Joshua Zirkzee, with defender Leny Yoro set to join him and Mason Greenwood on the brink of leaving
Manchester United are hopeful of making further progress today on the overhaul of Erik ten Hag's squad after falling short last season.
United have already signed Dutch forward Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna for £36.5million and are stepping up their efforts to further strengthen Ten Hag's playing personnel.
Mason Greenwood has agreed to join French side Marseille on a permanent switch worth around £25m, with United hopeful of concluding that deal today or tomorrow.

United are also aiming to confirm today the signing of defender Leny Yoro, from Lille, after reaching agreement with the French club on a fee that could ultimately rise to £58.45m. Yoro, 18, will sign a five-year contract with United, with the option for an extra year, and will link up with Lisandro Martinez in forming Ten Hag's first-choice central defensive partnership.

Yoro made 41 appearances in all competitions for Lille last season and scored three goals. He was also wanted by Real Madrid, but with only a year left on his contract, they were not prepared to pay as high a fee as United were willing to commit to.
United's signing of Yoro means their focus now is on selling players to raise funds to recruit a new central midfielder, with Paris Saint Germain's Manuel Ugarte among their top targets.
Although United do retain interest in Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite and Bayern Munich centre-back Matthijs De Ligt, they have shifted their recruitment focus to other areas of the team.
Any move for an additional defender is dependent on player sales, principally if United can offload Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof, thereby raising revenue to pay for a new centre-back.
United have cover there, with Jonny Evans having signed a one-year contract extension, while Luke Shaw has moved from left-back to the left side of central defence in the past.
Greenwood's move will bring to an end to his United career, with the forward having not played for the Red Devil since January 2022, following his arrest and subsequent suspension.
Greenwood was charged with attempted rape, assault and controlling and coercive behaviour, only for the Crown Prosecution Service to discontinue the case against the forward.

headline: Man Utd's stance on Matthijs de Ligt transfer emerges after medical completed
body: Manchester United are set to sign Leny Yoro after convincing the teenager his future lies at Old Trafford and the Red Devils could now drop interest in Matthijs de Ligt
Manchester United are expected to park their interest Matthijs de Ligt once they seal the capture of Lille prodigy Leny Yoro... unless there are defensive sales.

The Red Devils have been active in the transfer window with Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos at the helm with Yoro, 18, poised to become the club's second summer signing after Joshua Zirkzee completed his switch from Bologna at the weekend.

United have agreed a deal worth a potential £58million for Yoro, who was thought to be holding out for a dream transfer to Real Madrid. But the sought-after teenager is now set to complete his move to Old Trafford after agreeing personal terms and completing a medical on Wednesday, having been impressed by United's determination to sign him.
With a limited transfer budget, some have questioned whether Yoro's arrival will bring United's pursuit of De Ligt to an end - and it seems that could well be the case.
Manchester United headed into the summer with the intention of strengthening at centre-back and De Ligt, 24, was identified as a priority target alongside Yoro.

However, United are looking now to press ahead with strengthening in other areas after landing the France Under-21 star - putting any move for the Bayern Munich man on hold. That's not to say they won't return however; United could make further changes in defence if players can be moved on, and they remain admirers of the former Ajax man.

Lisandro Martinez is Ten Hag's No.1 centre-back but both Victor Lindelof and Harry Maguire could depart if the price is right. The club are actively seeking a buyer for Sweden international Lindelof who had his contract extended by a further year last season.
Maguire may not start the season as first-choice and he is determined to stay and fight for his place at Old Trafford. His wages are putting off potential Premier League suitors too.

United had two bids rejected for Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite this summer - refusing to go near Everton's £70million valuation - but their impending capture of Yoro, who has been on the club's radar for some time, is regarded as a major coup.

Yoro's preference had been a move to Real Madrid. But with the Spanish giants unwilling to meet Lille's demands and wanting to wait until next summer to sign Yoro on a free, he has decided his future lies in the Premier League with United.

headline: Ex-Man Utd coach at risk of sack in MLS after nine-game winless run
body: Former Manchester United assistant coach Eric Ramsay may be close to being relieved his duties after just a few months, with Minnesota United continuing to struggle in the MLS
Former Manchester United assistant manager Eric Ramsay could be close to being sacked by Minnesota United after going on a brutal nine-game winless streak.

Ramsay had worked under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer at Old Trafford and made his first move into management alongside Kieran McKenna and Michael Carrick - who have both thrived in their roles with Ipswich Town and Middlesbrough, respectively.

The 32-year-old had even begun seeing his name linked to a move back to English football, with several Championships teams said to have been monitoring him including Huddersfield and Sheffield Wednesday.

In his first role as a head coach, Ramsay had led the team to an incredible start in the MLS with his team looking like a surprise contender in the Western Conference. But after a brutal run of six losses and three draws, Ramsey is under significant pressure to be removed.
Minnesota United are the most out-of-form team in the MLS, with Ramsay being reliant on goals from former Norwich City striker Teemu Pukki - who has himself struggled in recent weeks.
When Ramsay left United earlier this year, he'd been seen as the club's most promising young coach - with the 32-year-old decided to take the job with the MLS outfit.

Before United, Ramsay ahead been with Chelsea as an U23 assistant coach, as well as on the international stage with Rob Page's Wales. Speaking on Ramsay, Page said: "Eric is arguably one of the best young coaches in football at this moment in time."

Despite their brutal nine-game winless streak, Minnesota remains in the hunt for the playoffs as they sit in ninth place in the Western Conference with the team having 10 games to go in the hopes of making the postseason.
Ramsay had turned down multiple opportunities in England before making the move to the MLS, reportedly having interest from Swansea City and Blackpool over the last year before joining Minnesota.

McKenna had reported interest from both Manchester United and Chelsea to become their manager, but ended up signing a long-term extension to remain with Ipswich.

headline: Thierry Henry's glowing verdict on Leny Yoro - but words come with a warning to Man Utd
body: France Under-21s boss Thierry Henry has given his thoughts on Leny Yoro's potential, with the 18-year-old on the verge of completing a big money move to Manchester United
Manchester United are closing in on the signing of Leny Yoro in a deal worth up to £52million and Thierry Henry has delivered a glowing verdict of the 18-year-old's potential.

United have beaten off Liverpool and Real Madrid for Yoro's signature, with the teenager set to become their second signing of the summer after striker Joshua Zirkzee joined from Bologna. The Red Devils have agreed an initial fee of £42m, plus an additional £10m in add-ons.

And Arsenal legend Henry, who gave Yoro his debut for France's Under-21s when he was just 17, believes the defender has a huge future ahead of him. However, he did admit that a player as young as Yoro will "make mistakes" as he continues to learn his trade.

"We often talk about Leny," Henry told Le Petit Lillois earlier this year. "He is having an exemplary start to his career. To establish himself in Lille as he is doing… He always has some young reactions, and that is completely normal.
"It comes slowly, you make mistakes and sometimes you get embarrassed. (But) he goes on to play one match after another, he starts quite often and quite often is good. It's really good for him.

"He is professional, he's a good guy, well-educated. I like him. He performs well. Afterwards, there are always things to refine, but that's completely normal. Frankly, it's really a more than positive progression."

United academy graduate Angel Gomes, who is now one of Yoro's teammates at Lille, has also backed him to be a success at Old Trafford. "As soon as he arrived in the group, I understood that he was going to reach the summits," Gomes told Eurosport.

"When I discovered the pros at the age of 16 at Manchester United, I understood that it was different. He already had the right temperament. That's not normal for a 16- or 17-year-old player arriving. It's like he's already an experienced player and it showed in the way he trained, the way he behaved. His progress was obvious."

Former Lille boss Paulo Fonseca, who left the club to take over AC Milan this summer, also believes Yoro has a huge future. "I believe Leny in the next year will be at one of the best clubs in Europe," Fonseca said earlier this year.

"He started here at 16 with us. He is very ambitious but very disciplined. "He grew a lot but he is a kid with a big maturity, with big quality. He's very focused and very concentrated, he wants to learn every day. I have no doubt in modern football he will be one of the best central defenders in the world."

headline: Fred showed true colours the one time he responded to Roy Keane's relentless criticism
body: Roy Keane has never pulled any punches when it comes to criticising an under-performing player with ex-Manchester United midfielder Fred receiving the brunt of it during his time in England
Manchester United flop Fred possessed a cool head when responding to the unrelenting criticism levied at him by Roy Keane.

The Brazilian enjoyed five years at Old Trafford but he largely left fans wanting more following his £50million move from Shakhtar Donetsk in 2018. While he was a regular starter for the Red Devils during his tenure, he failed to meet the expectations of the fanbase, which led to his departure last year upon the expiration of his contract.
The 31-year-old was regularly subject to criticism during his time in Manchester with Keane being a constant conveyer of the Brazilian's inadequacy as part of United's midfield.

Alongside his midfield partner Scott McTominay, who also wasn't immune from the wrath of the former United captain, the pair were famously blasted by the Irishman who once said: "As long as those two are playing in midfield for Manchester United, they will not be winning big trophies".

"It's their job and it's their right to do so. I don't agree with it but it's their opinion. I'm not confrontational, I've heard a lot of negative comments about me, always negative, but I won't say anything back. My focus is to work on the pitch."

Among the several soundbites Keane's offered up during his punditry career, one of the more scathing pieces of analysis came in United's first league game of the 2022/23 campaign when they suffered a shock 2-1 loss to Brighton at Old Trafford.

As expected, Fred and McTominay were in the firing line as a fiery Keane ranted: "The [lack of] decision-making and football intelligence from midfield, particularly Fred. I've been going on about it for a long time – Fred and [Scott] McTominay are not good enough. They won't get Manchester United back to competing at the top. We see it week in, week out. They're not up to it".
The Brazilian couldn't even escape the 52-year-old in his last game for the club which came in United's 2-1 FA Cup final defeat to Manchester City last year.

After fouling Kevin De Bruyne whose free-kick ended up finding Ilkay Gundogan who scored his second goal of the game during the Wembley clash, Keane unloaded on the midfielder, calling his decision to foul the Belgian the "height of stupidity".

"Fred had Kevin de Bruyne where he wants him," Keane told ITV Sport. "De Bruyne has his back to goal and then Fred fouls him. It's the height of stupidity. But we've seen that from him so many times over the years."

headline: Man Utd name Aaron Wan-Bissaka price as Red Devils set to make huge loss
body: Manchester United may be about to take a huge financial hit on Aaron Wan-Bissaka with an Old Trafford exit potentially on the cards five years after his £50m move
Manchester United are willing to take a £35million hit on Aaron Wan-Bissaka amid a potential summer exit.

The right-back has endured a mixed time at Old Trafford since moving north from Crystal Palace back in 2019. He was the first major signing of the Ole Gunnar Solskjaer era and set the club back £50m as they pounced following a huge breakout year for the right-back.

Originally a regular, Wan-Bissaka has been in and out of the first-team with Diogo Dalot often preferred. He has played in notable games under Erik ten Hag, but the club are still willing to sanction his departure.

West Ham are among those keen and could land the former Palace defender for £15m. The Hammers and United are reportedly locked in talks over a potential deal, according to talkSPORT, with the Red Devils triggering a 12-month extension in his deal to stop him leaving for nothing this summer.

He has made 190 appearances for United, scoring twice, but he could soon find himself at the London Stadium as the Red Devils look to get players off their books to help finance their summer business with more new signings on Ten Hag's wish list.
This time last year the United boss admitted that Wan-Bissaka "was out in the cold and looked like he was on his way out of Manchester United" before his performances landed him another season.

The former Palace man, who was once tipped for England but is yet to land international recognition, has admitted he thought his career in Manchester was up as soon as Ten Hag arrived before knuckling down to extend his time at Old Trafford.

He said previously: "It was a hard time and the only thing you can do during a hard time is keep working. I got my head down and then got the chance and was able to help the team. You can just sit there and complain about it and not care, or you can actually try and I thought the best way was for me to try."

Last term Wan-Bissaka started 20 times in the Premier League but United are attempting to bolster their backline as they close in on the £52m capture of Leny Yoro from Lille. Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite are also on their shortlist.

headline: Adrien Rabiot set for fresh Man Utd talks after making transfer decision
body: Juventus midfielder Adrien Rabiot is free to hold talks with other clubs after running down his contract in Italy with Liverpool and Manchester United among his suitors
Adrien Rabiot will hold talks with Liverpool and Manchester United in the coming days after leaving Juventus.
The Frenchman, 29, became a free agent at the start of the month after running down his contract at the Allianz Stadium and will officially announce his departure from the Italian giants this week.

That decision is likely to lead to a number of top European clubs making their move - and the midfield maestro will explore a move to the Premier League amid interest from two of England's biggest clubs.
Rabiot intends to speak with all of his suitors as he weighs up his next move, as outlined by Football Italia, including Liverpool and United.
Newcastle are another club who are set to hold discussions with Rabiot, while AC Milan and Napoli, now managed by Antonio Conte, will attempt to persuade him to remain in Italy.
Rabiot is looking for a contract worth £7.5m a year: a sum that may be too rich for clubs in Serie A. Juventus offered a base salary of £5.8m in their final contract offer.
Rabiot has been regularly linked with a move to the Premier League in recent years and Manchester United are long-term admirers of the midfielder.

Rabiot was in talks with the Red Devils when he was still on the books at Paris-Saint Germain before then-manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer decided against pushing ahead with a deal. And Rabiot was back on the club's radar following the appointment of Erik ten Hag, but again, a deal failed to materialise.

headline: Leny Yoro transfer leaves Erik ten Hag with headache after Man Utd promise
body: Manchester United are closing in on defensive target Leny Yoro, with the Lille defender headed for the UK for discussions, but Erik tan Hag has more work to do this summer
Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag may be forced to abandon one of his other defensive targets if the club completes a deal for Leny Yoro, with the Dutchman also facing a selection dilemma.

French teenager Yoro had appeared to favour Real Madrid over an Old Trafford switch, but things have taken a turn with Los Blancos failing to match United's £52m bid. The Lille starlet is on his way to Manchester for a medical, with a deal seemingly imminent.

This was always likely to be a busy summer for the Premier League club, with defenders Raphael Varane and Willy Kambwala both leaving and Victor Lindelof linked with a move away. Yoro is one of a number of players targeted, along with Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite, but his arrival could well see one of those names drop off the list.

Mirror Football understands Ten Hag has told De Ligt he plans to offer him regular first-team football, something the ex-Ajax star isn't guaranteed at current club Bayern Munich. However, with Lisandro Martinez one of the first names on the teamsheet under Ten Hag, it could be left-sided defender Branthwaite who ends up staying put.
Former Premier League midfielder Remy Cabella has been among those to bang the drum for Yoro. The 34-year-old, formerly of Newcastle United, played with the teenager at Lille last season.

"At Marseille, I knew Boubacar Kamara, at Saint-Etienne, William Saliba and Wesley Fofana, and now there's Leny Yoro," the French international said, per Goal. "He has all the qualities and potential to do something huge. He's very humble, and that's another of his strengths."

Despite only turning 18 in November, Yoro developed into a regular at Lille last term. He played 44 times in all competitions, scoring three times, as Les Dogues finished fourth in Ligue 1 and reached the quarter-finals of the Europa Conference League.

United, who finished in eighth place in the Premier League last season, have already begun their summer rebuild. It is their first transfer window of the INEOS era, with part-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe hiring Dan Ashworth, Omar Berrada and Jason Wilcox to take charge of the club's business.

Joshua Zirkzee has already joined, with a £36.5m move from Bologna completed over the weekend. The former Bayern Munich forward will provide competition for Rasmus Hojlund up front following the departure of Cristiano Ronaldo and Anthony Martial during Ten Hag's two years as manager.

“He’s a player who can link up the game, who can be available, hold up the ball, have good ideas, be creative and who can dribble in combinations,” Ten Hag said of Zirkzee. “So that's a different type [of player] and always what we are looking for, so it gives us more options tactically, which is good.
“Particularly up front, we have many players who can play very direct, so they can take a big benefit for his skills.”

Manchester United have already landed a deal for Joshua Zirkzee and a second could be inbound in the form of Leny Yoro.

The Red Devils have ramped up their transfer activity in recent weeks, which has coincided with the arrival of Dan Ashworth as sporting director. Erik ten Hag's position was confirmed shortly after the FA Cup victory and he's set about targeting problem areas in the squad.

Defensive recruits - as well as more firepower - are likely to be their main priorities. They also retain an interest in PSG's Manuel Ugarte but they are working with a limited budget and may have to offload players to spend more with the likes of Harry Maguire linked with the exit door.
Here's the latest transfer news coming out of Old Trafford.

A deal has been struck for Lille star Yoro, who has flown in from France to undergo a medical after a £52million deal was struck. The stumbling block looked to be the player's desire to move to Real Madrid, who were also in the race to sign him.

Los Blancos were keen on waiting until he was available on a free, but Lille's agreement with United means that Yoro will now head to the north west of England to finalise personal terms, reports the Athletic. The Red Devils have the young centre-half on their shortlist and the French club were looking to sell with Yoro's contract winding down.

The Ligue 1 side had strongly favoured a deal with the Red Devils as they looked to cash in on their asset. United are hoping to secure a player in Yoro who is regarded across the game as being a generational talent.

The Red Devils will land 50 percent of any future transfer fee as part of Mason Greenwood's move to Marseille. The two clubs have agreed a £23.3million deal for Greenwood, who spent last season on loan at Spanish side Getafe and has a host of European clubs now eyeing him.

The forward last played for United two-and-a-half years ago before he was arrested and subsequently suspended by the club. Those at Old Trafford acknowledge they cannot allow Greenwood to play for the club again but want to maximise their profits.

They are conscious though of Greenwood maximising his talent and eventually become a world star, which would see his value skyrocket. United want to ensure they would be rewarded financially if the 22-year-old does move on to even bigger and better things.

headline: NBA icon Kevin Durant wastes no time picking between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo
body: Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant was asked who he prefers out of footballing greats Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, with the two-time NBA champion barely giving his answer a thought
NBA legend Kevin Durant has weighed in on the Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo debate by declaring the Portuguese star as the "goat".

Durant, who now plays for Phoenix Suns after stints with Golden State Warriors and the Brooklyn Nets, was being interviewed by YouTuber Speed, and then later by Logan Paul & Mike Majlak on their podcast 'Impaulsive'. On both occasions when asked who he thought was better, the basketball icon took a slight pause before stating that Ronaldo was his preferred choice.

Discourse over who is the better player out of the two has been raging for years with pundits and fans alike often unable to seperate them. There was no such issue with Durant though with the two-time NBA champion, double MVP, and triple Olympic gold medalist knowing a thing or two about what it takes to make it as a sporting great.

The 30-year-old, who has also been selected for the All Star team 14 times in his storied career on the court, was approached by Speed, who pops the question about Ronaldo or Messi. Durant then takes a step back and ponders the query for a very brief moment before confidently stating it's Ronaldo he favours.

Speed then laughs before declaring that "KD is a Ronaldo fan" and that the former Oklahoma Thunder player "knows who the goat is". If you want to contextualise the argument over just who is the best ever between Ronaldo and Messi it's worth looking at the trophy hauls, both for team and individually, throughout their careers.

The Argentinian has won an astonishing eight Ballons d'Or compared to Ronaldo's five, eight of FIFA World's Best Player awards to Ronaldo's five, and six European Golden Shoes to Ronaldo's four, making him the most decorated player in the history of the game. Messi's unrivalled haul of 45 senior titles will seal the debate for most, and after he led Argentina to victory in the 2022 World Cup, a number of commentators and players have settled on Messi. But that's not the case according to Durant.

While Messi currently plays for Inter Miami, he spent the bulk of his professional career with Barcelona where he won 10 La Liga titles, seven Copa del Rey titles, and the Champions League four times. Ronaldo has played for several clubs throughout his career although trophies have often followed wherever he played his game.

His trophy cabinet, despite being slightly smaller than Messi's, is still nothing to be sniffed at with the Real Madrid and Manchester United legend winning 33 trophies in his career. This includes seven league titles, five Champions Leagues, Euro 2016 with Portugal and the UEFA Nations League.

headline: Gareth Southgate hires pal of Sir Jim Ratcliffe as new advisor after quitting England jobVIDEO
body: Gareth Southgate decided to leave his role with England after a hugely successful eight-year spell with the Three Lions and amid links with Manchester United has sought advice from a friend of Sir Jim Ratcliffe
Outgoing England boss Gareth Southgate has turned to Sir Jim Ratciffe ’s associate for help following his resignation.
Southgate announced earlier this week that he would be stepping down from his Three Lions role. The decision came after England’s Euro 2024 final defeat to Spain.

And in the aftermath of his exit, Southgate has sought advice from a close friend of Sir Jim Ratcliffe as he considers his next steps in management. According to The Sun, the 52-year-old has been working with Jimmy Worrall since splitting with his agent Terry Byrne.

Worrall is the founder and chairman of Leaders in Sport, a company who run worldwide networking events. He also acts as a consultant and has worked as an advisor for the likes of INEOS and the European Club Association.
Ex-England boss Southgate has known Worrall for years. He has decided to rely on his advice as opposed to employing a full-time agent following his split from former representative Byrne.
Worrall has already been involved in the talks that saw his spell as England boss come to an end. He could potentially play a huge role in his next career move.

There will naturally be links with Manchester United given Worrall’s previous work with INEOS. He also has a close relationship with Sir Dave Brailsford, who pushed for the appointment of Dan Ashworth at Old Trafford.
Southgate has been linked with the Red Devils in the past. Ratcliffe installed him as his favoured option should he have sacked Erik ten Hag.
In the end, United chose to shelve a move, with Ratcliffe sticking by current boss Ten Hag. He eventually signed a new contract with the Red Devils.

headline: Man Utd fans call for Harry Maguire to return as captain after pre-season video emerges
body: Harry Maguire has been praised by Manchester United fans after a video emerged which showed him taking time to speak to all the academy players at the training ground
Manchester United fans have called on Erik ten Hag to reinstate Harry Maguire as captain after being reminded of his leadership skills in a behind-the-scenes video.

Maguire is one of few senior United players training at their Carrington complex after missing out on Euro 2024 due to injury. The 31-year-old defender was cut from Gareth Southgate’s squad after failing to shake off a calf injury and has been working hard to regain full fitness for the 2024/25 campaign with United.

He was not a part of the United squad which travelled to Trondheim to play Rosenborg on Monday and instead stayed behind to train alongside some of the club’s youngsters. And in a clip from MUTV, Maguire was shown saying hello to and shaking the hands of every player in the gym on training bikes.

Maguire goes along the line of academy players, who look delighted to get recognition from a senior player. The centre-back was stripped of the United captaincy by Erik ten Hag in July 2023, with the Dutchman opting to hand the armband to Bruno Fernandes, but he clearly still commands respect among the players.

The video clip went viral on Twitter, with many United fans posting praise for Maguire – with some suggesting he should replace Fernandes as skipper. “Acting like a leader,” one fan wrote. Another wrote: “That's my captain there”. “A captain’s attitude,” a third added.

Another wrote: “You always hear from many players in and around the squad how Maguire makes them feel welcoming and at home right away. This is a nice example of this in training this week greeting all the young lads. A class act and great leader.”

Maguire joined United in a £80million transfer from Leicester in the summer of 2019 and was made captain by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer in January 2020. Solskjaer revealed earlier this year that he had doubts about Fernandes’ suitability for the role.

“I knew Bruno Fernandes had captain qualities when I was manager at Manchester United,” he said on the Stick to Football podcast. “He’s got the personality and quality – but he knows and I’ve told him – that he’s too passionate at times and he loses a bit of control. I loved Harry Maguire as a captain, he was the leader in that group for me when I was at the club.”
He added: “The way that Harry Maguire has handled himself with everything happening to him at Manchester United is top class and just shows the character he’s got, that I want in players.”

Ten Hag is very unlikely to go back on his decision, especially given that Maguire is not guaranteed a place in the starting XI. United have spent £52m to bring in Leny Yoro, who could partner Lisandro Martinez in defence, while Matthijs de Ligt could also be arriving this summer.

headline: Man Utd reject transfer bid for Scott McTominay from Premier League rival
body: Scott McTominay managed to force himself back into Manchester United contention last season having looked set for an exit and the Red Devils have now shared their stance on a sale
Manchester United have turned down a bid from Fulham for academy graduate Scott McTominay.

The Red Devils midfielder has just a year remaining on his contract at Old Trafford - albeit United having an option to extend that deal by a further year. His precarious situation has left McTominay’s future far from certain.
And Premier League rivals have attempted to take advantage of that with a move. Fulham have reportedly tabled their opening bid for the Scottish midfielder.
But according to Mail Online, that offer has been rebuffed by the Red Devils. It is suggested that Fulham’s bid is lower than a £30m offer that Man United turned down from West Ham last summer.

McTominay looked set for an Old Trafford exit 12 months ago but enjoyed a dramatic u-turn under current boss Erik ten Hag. The 27-year-old scored a career-best 10 goals last term despite a tricky season from the Red Devils’ perspective.
Ten Hag regularly underlined how crucial McTominay had been. Speaking last season, the Dutchman said: “Every player has a price but he has a big value, sporting and also economic.

“I want to have a player like Scott McTominay in the squad. He is Manchester United in every faith. Every minute he will fight for the match. He is Manchester United in everything in his heart. When you are coming on and giving this to the team it tells a lot.”

"He is Manchester United in everything and in his heart,” the Red Devils’ boss added. ”So he's playing for the badge. He gives his life. And when you're coming on and you give this to the team, it tells a lot."

While Fulham are interested in a move for McTominay, foreign sides are also keeping a close eye on him. Galatasaray vice president Ibrahim Hatipoglu confirmed that his side had added the midfielder to their shortlist for the summer.
"McTominay's transfer fee is being discussed," he was quoted by Haber Sarı Kırmızı. "Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg is a good player, he has many suitors, he wants to see all options.

"There is no talk of single-digit figures for right-back and midfield transfers. But we have allocated a budget of less than €10million for right-back. There is no negative situation regarding Guela Doue [Rennes right-back]. Negotiations are ongoing [for] McTominay and Doue. Wan-Bissaka is not our priority."

headline: Jadon Sancho insider tells Man Utd that Erik ten Hag has ‘big problems’ with winger
body: Jadon Sancho has been welcomed back into the fold at Manchester United by Erik ten Hag, but the winger's former Borussia Dortmund manager foresees more problems
Erik ten Hag is to blame for the difficulties between him and Jadon Sancho – and they are likely to continue at Manchester United, according to Sancho’s former manager.

Sancho was exiled by Ten Hag after a public falling out and spent the second half of last season on loan at former club Borussia Dortmund. He enjoyed his time back in Germany, but has now returned to his parent club with Dortmund likely unable to afford to sign him permanently.

The winger has been handed a second chance by Ten Hag, who has allowed him to return to first-team training ahead of the 2024/25 campaign. The Dutchman has said they have “drawn the line” under the falling out and want to move on.

But Lucien Favre, who managed Sancho for two years during his first spell at Dortmund, has suggested that the ill-feeling between the two may linger – and that Ten Hag is to blame, given Sancho’s professionalism under his tutelage.

“Sancho is undoubtedly a top player. I remember when he continued working on the pitch after finishing training sessions at Borussia Dortmund,” Favre told Tuttosport. “He wanted to improve in everything. Shooting, passing, crosses. It was a pleasure to see him during those extra 20 minutes on the pitch.

“I’ve heard that there have been problems, big problems, between him and Ten Hag. When somebody like Sancho, with his strong commitment, arrives late for training sessions, it means that somebody is not working properly.”

Ten Hag and Sancho fell out after the Dutchman publicly called him out for poor displays in training. The Englishman responded on social media, denying the allegations while effectively accusing his boss of lying.

Sancho was banished from first-team training and hasn’t played a competitive match for his club since August 2023. He refused to back down and eventually found an exit route to Dortmund in January. But now back at United, he has attempted to mend his relationship with Ten Hag.
“As we said, we've drawn the line,” said Ten Hag, when asked about Sancho. “Manchester United needs good players and Jadon is a good player. We have drawn that line and we move on.”

Sancho was not a part of the United squad which lost 1-0 to Rosenberg on Monday, but will be involved in the upcoming friendlies against Rangers, Arsenal, Real Betis and Liverpool on their pre-season tour before the Community Shield against Manchester City next month. The 24-year-old is understood to have wanted to stay with Dortmund, but he still has two years left on his United contract, which pays around £290,000-a-week, making a transfer difficult.

headline: Leny Yoro transfer has immediate knock-on effect for Man Utd signing Jarrad Branthwaite
body: Manchester United saw two bids rejected by Everton for Jarrad Branthwaite earlier this summer and the £52m signing of Leny Yoro will complicate negotiations further
Manchester United appear to have sacrificed their chances of landing Everton star Jarrad Branthwaite by splashing the cash to sign Leny Yoro.

United have committed to signing Yoro from Lille for an initial fee of £52million, which could rise as high as £62m with add-ons. The 18-year-old Frenchman is poised to sign a five-year contract with United after flying in to finalise terms and complete a medical on Wednesday.

The agreement comes as a surprise, with many in the industry, including Liverpool, believing that Real Madrid were in pole position to sign Yoro. He is set to become the second summer signing for United after striker Joshua Zirkzee, who cost £36.5m from Bologna.

The need for central defenders was clear for United this summer after Raphael Varane was released at the end of his contract. The club have since sold Willy Kambwala to Villarreal and are open to offers for Victor Lindelof, increasing the need for reinforcements in the position.

However, it seems United have burned their bridges with Everton over the potential addition of Branthwaite. Manchester Evening News reports that the Toffees have been emboldened in their stance on Branthwaite, having previously rejected two offers from United for the defender.

United saw bids worth £43m and £50m rejected earlier this summer, with Everton insisting they value the 21-year-old at a minimum of £70m. Having seen United spend £52m on an 18-year-old who has no Premier League or international experience, they are convinced they have taken the right approach in negotiations over Branthwaite.

Erik ten Hag’s side had tried to play hard ball in talks over the centre-back, insisting they only had a limited transfer budget due to profit and sustainability considerations. Yet United have since committed to spending a combined £88.5m to sign Zirkzee and Yoro to undermine their negotiating position.

Everton are selling Amadou Onana to Aston Villa for £50m and are therefore under no financial pressure to also let go of Branthwaite, who impressed last season alongside James Tarkowski. United have previously annoyed Everton by submitting a joint £28m offer for Leighton Baines and Marouane Fellaini in 2013 and will likely have to look elsewhere if they want another centre-back this summer.

United have been in talks with Bayern Munich over signing Matthijs de Ligt, but that deal has already potentially been complicated by Yoro’s arrival. Mirror Football understands that Ten Hag has told De Ligt that he wants him to play alongside Lisandro Martinez – a promise he might have to break now Yoro is on the scene.

Ten Hag has been able to boost his transfer budget by allowing Varane and Anthony Martial to leave on free transfers, while selling Kambwala, Donny van de Beek and Alvaro Fernandez. The club are hoping to net a further £30m for Mason Greenwood, which can be reinvested in new players.

The signing of Leny Yoro will not end Manchester United's hopes of landing another central defender.

Manchester United are set to secure their second transfer of the summer, with the Lille defender set to undergo a medical at Old Trafford. The 18-year-old will command a £52million fee, with the Red Devils now holding the advantage after the Frenchman had been expected to join Real Madrid.

Heading into the summer, the club planned to strengthen in the centre of defence, midfield and up front. United still intend to add another defender should they be able to raise funds through sales, according to the Daily Mail.

The club continue to target Everton's Jarrod Branthwaite and Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt. Sporting director Dan Ashworth has seen the Toffees reject bids for Branthwaite, with a £45m offer dismissed.
Everton are hopeful of nearer £70m for the 22-year-old. And the figure United are set to spend on Yoro could strengthen the resolve of Sean Dyche's side.

Ten Hag is more familiar with De Ligt who he coached while at Ajax. It is understood United's boss has already held direct talks with his countryman, with reports suggesting personal terms are already agreed.
German giants Bayern are said to want £42m for the 24-year-old they signed in a deal that could rise to £68m from Juventus.
Speaking last month Ten Hag explained the transfers that would help United progress. The 54-year-old wants to see his side bounce back from eighth place in the Premier League.
"We need to get a striker in to work alongside Rasmus Hojlund," he said. "I also hope we manage to get another central midfielder and also a replacement for Varane.

headline: Unrecognisable ex-Man Utd star 'left bloodied by attack' after Euro 2024 final
body: Former Manchester United star Andrei Kanchelskis was in a Moscow bar watching the Euro 2024 final between England and Spain when he was involved in a violent altercation
Ex-Man Utd star Andrei Kanchelskis has been left with a gruesome eye injury after allegedly being attacked in a bar.
The two-time Premier League champion was watching the Euro 2024 final between England and Spain in a Moscow bar. But his evening took a shocking turn after he was involved in a violent incident.
Reports have suggested he was attacked after exchanging insults with a fellow reveller. Punches were then thrown, leaving Kanchelskis, 55, needing first aid from staff.
An ambulance was called but the former forward did not need a hospital trip. He has since shared a few updates on his condition - including a gruesome selfie showing his swollen and bruised eye.

Speaking to Russian outlet SE about the attack, Kanchelskis said: "I’m fine now. A small conflict, we clashed over interests after the final match of the Euros. I want to note that the conflict did not happen because of the football match - but a personal matter.
"I wrote a statement to the police about my offender. What will happen next I don’t want to advertise it. A trial is possible, and I will wait for the decision. We will do everything within the law.”

Kanchelskis spent four years at Old Trafford under Sir Alex Ferguson after arriving from Shakhtar Donetsk. He scored 36 goals across 161 appearances, winning two Premier League titles, the League Cup and the FA Cup.
He was sold to Everton and went on to play for rivals Man City, Rangers and Fiorentina. But the Red Devils always held a special place in his heart.

Speaking to MailOnline, Kanchelskis said: “I love Manchester United. In my heart it’s still the best club in Europe. Maybe I will come to the new Everton stadium in August, it depends on my future.
“Of course, I will go to Old Trafford and visit Sir Alex. I will bring him a present of black caviar, because he loves it.”

He has been left furious at the problems the Red Devils have faced over recent seasons. Analysing their struggles, Kanchelskis added: “When I played for United, the dressing-room, the players were held together, but I don’t understand what’s happening at Manchester United now. I think there are some problems somewhere.
“If you see in the past, everybody was working for these titles: the people cleaning the kitchen, the director, the secretary, the players, the kit man.
"First of all Man Utd, it’s a big club and like a family. Some people playing for Man United now don’t remember what happened. There’s no family now, in my opinion.”

headline: Leny Yoro's contract details emerge as Man Utd move swiftly to complete £52m transfer
body: Manchester United are on the verge of sealing their second transfer of the summer with Leny Yoro set to complete his medical to reinforce Erik ten Hag's defence at Old Trafford
Leny Yoro is set to sign a five-year deal with Manchester United should he pass his medical.

United have agreed a £52million fee with Lille that could rise as high as £59m with add-ons. The agreement was made last week before the 18-year-old defender decided to make the move on Tuesday evening.
Yoro has arrived in the North West to finalise terms and undergo a medical. A one-year option to extend his contract by 12 months will be in place as part of the five-year deal he is set to sign.

The Frenchman is set to become Erik ten Hag's second signing of the summer after the Red Devils secured the signing of Joshua Zirkzee for £36.5m from Bologna. Real Madrid had led the race for the ace who has drawn comparisons to Virgil van Dijk.

Los Blancos have so far appeared unwilling to meet the fee that Manchester United have offered. Lille prefer to make a deal this summer rather than lose him on a free next summer after his contract expires.

Liverpool and Paris Saint-Germain have also been reported to be interested in the teenager but Real were the long-time favourites. United have taken advantage of a deal not being done to pounce however.

United have not ended their hopes of adding another defender to their backline but will be required to sell players before doing so. The club have seen bids rejected for Jarrod Branthwaite already this summer.

The 13-time Premier League champion's move for Yoro could ensure a deal for the 22-year-old continues to prove difficult. The Toffees are said to have been emboldened in their stance after knocking back deals worth £43m and £50m.

Sean Dyche's side are said to want nearer £70m for their defender who still has a contract until 2027. Everton have previously highlighted the fees spent on Harry Maguire, Wesley Fofana and Josko Gvardiol in recent years, which are all £75m or above.

The Goodison Park side are also now under less pressure to sell with the club on the bring of selling Amadou Onana to Aston Villa for £50m. Onana joined Everton from Lille in 2022 for £30m and made 37 appearances in all competitions for the club.
Villa are looking to strengthen their midfield as they embark on a Champions League campaign. Unai Emery's side have already seen Douglas Luiz depart for Juventus and have signed Ross Barkley.

headline: Why Liverpool pulled out of Leny Yoro transfer race as fans fume at £52m Man Utd move
body: Leny Yoro is having a medical before completing switch to Manchester United - and Liverpool's apparent reason for withdrawing the interest has left supporters raging
Manchester United have pipped Liverpool to the signing of Leny Yoro - in part because the Merseyside club thought the centre-back was only interested in joining Real Madrid.

But after the La Liga champions decided against moving this summer, having already put resources into bringing in France superstar Kylian Mbappe, United have snuck in to complete a deal worth up to £52m with Lille. It's understood Liverpool were under the impression that Madrid were favourites - and decided against stepping up their interest this summer.

Yoro, 18, will have his medical on Tuesday before finalising personal terms - and he will become the second signing of the summer at United, following the acquisition of Netherlands forward Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna.

He is expected to sign a five-year deal, while United remain interested in another Dutch player, Bayern Munich ’s Matthijs de Ligt, and have had two bids - the most recent of which was £45m - rejected by Everton for up-and-coming England international Jarrad Branthwaite.

Centre back has been earmarked as the area needing the greatest overhaul by head coach Erik ten Hag. Raphael Varane left the club at the end of last season, while they are open to offers for Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof.

After Zirkzee's arrival was confirmed on Sunday, Ten Hag said: "He is a player who can link up the game, who can be available, hold up the ball, have good ideas, be creative, can dribble, [make] combinations.

"So that's a different type and always what we are looking for, so it gives us more options tactically, which is good because, especially up front, we have many players who can play very direct and they can take a big benefit from his skills."

However the Yoro deal has appeared to catch Liverpool ’s recruitment department and owners FSG out, leading to a predictably furious response from some of their supporters online. "FSG have been found out yet again," one fan posted on X. Another added: "Liverpool are far too big for FSG."

And one fan went further by questioning the club’s entire strategy, writing: "We didn't bid for Yoro because we have no money, plain and simple, as we haven't sold anyone yet. Sell to buy merchants. FSG run Liverpool like Bournemouth."

New boss Arne Slot is yet to see an addition made to his squad, although leading goalscorer Mo Salah is expected to stay despite interest from clubs in Saudi Arabia. The club also have no interest in selling Trent Alexander-Arnold despite the England star entering the final year of his contract.

body: Leny Yoro is closing in on becoming Manchester United's second summer signing after Joshua Zirkzee completed his move earlier this week, but who should be next?

Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign Leny Yoro from Lille. United had an offer accepted last week and the 18-year-old has decided to join the club, despite interest from Real Madrid.

The fee is expected to rise to around €70million (£58.7m) for the Frenchman, who was named in the Ligue 1 Team of the Year after impressing last season. Yoro is poised to become United's second signing of the summer after Joshua Zirkzee arrived from Bologna in a £36.5m move.

It's expected to take their spending to £95.2m for the summer, with more incomings anticipated as they look to sell several squad members. Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Casemiro, Mason Mount and Harry Maguire are among the players being linked with moves away as United look to raise some cash.
But who else should United sign this summer? MEN writers have their say on who the Red Devils should target as their next and third arrival in the transfer window...

A centre-back and a striker were the priority for United at the start of this window and if they secure both before heading off on tour it will have to be considered an excellent start. The reality is sales are now required to boost the budget and who goes might condition who is next to arrive.
United will have to sell another central defender, probably Victor Lindelof, and there are midfielders who could depart, notably Casemiro, while there have been bids for Scott McTominay.

Another, slightly more senior centre-back, would be a preference and Matthijs de Ligt could yet tick that box. The most interesting situation is Casemiro's, however. If United are to replace him it probably needs to happen sooner rather than later and that is why midfield should be the next area to look at.

Before the transfer window opened, I said United's priority must be signing a quality defensive midfielder to replace Casemiro and my opinion hasn't changed. The Brazilian's regression was significant last season and persisting with him in the new campaign is inadvisable.
Finding the right player to succeed Casemiro is the challenge. Joao Palhinha appealed, but he's joined Bayern Munich from Fulham and the market isn't bursting with options.
Nonetheless, now a forward and a defender have been brought in - although Leny Yoro's move isn't official yet - United should focus their efforts on signing that player.
Perhaps PSG's midfielder Ugrarte fits the billing and he'd add to the South American influence in the dressing room.

It's clear as day that United need to strengthen their midfield this summer. They need someone to partner Kobbie Mainoo for the long-term as I am not convinced Casemiro can still cut it at the top level. The Brazilian looked way off his best last season, and at 32, should United look to the future? I think so.

Crystal Palace starlet Adam Wharton is the man they should look at. He has impressed since moving to Palace from Blackburn in January and could immediately solve United's midfield problem. That is the area United should look at next, with Wharton the most ideal candidate available right now.

Signing Yoro is a huge coup for United: it also means they don't need to get sucked into time-sensitive transfer sagas, overbidding for targets as they have done in previous summers. So, what do they need to do next? United could do with another centre-back along with Yoro: Matthijs De Ligt fits the bill at the right price. Jarrad Branthwaite would be a superb signing, but looks too expensive at this point - especially with Everton left baffled by the Yoro fee.

A left-back would be welcome given Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia's injury records, while Ten Hag also desperately needs a defensive midfielder: PSG's Manuel Ugarte looks a good prospect for an affordable fee, but that deal likely rests on Casemiro being sold. In truth, the rest of United's transfer window hinges on who can be sold to raise more funds.

If Ineos can get Casemiro, Mason Greenwood, Christian Eriksen and one of Victor Lindelof or Harry Maguire (or both of them) out the door, then De Ligt, Ugarte and a left-back would represent upgrades across the squad. Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho leaving now looks less likely, but if United could sell either then I would also pick up a winger and/or a striker: Ivan Toney and Federico Chiesa would offer goals, experience and depth at affordable prices.

Capturing Matthijs de Ligt as well as Yoro is a mouth-watering prospect but one that could be scuppered by past transfer failings. United are thought to be operating on a net transfer budget of just £50m, having so far received an initial £10m for two sales and spent £36m on the arrival of Joshua Zirkzee.

The purchase of Yoro will take the net spend up to £85m with a midfielder still to buy. The probable exit of Mason Greenwood for around £27m will lower this back down to circa £58m but sales will still be needed.
De Ligt would be a great addition but will cost £42m, money that ought to be first spent on a midfielder. United are expected to offload Casemiro and a replacement will be needed.

£101m-rated Joao Neves is too expensive for a player with just 75 club appearances, while a return deal for Sofyan Amrabat seems risky, albeit much cheaper. If a deal under £40m can be secured for Manuel Ugarte, it might be worth the punt.
It's been a promising transfer window for United so far this summer and it will be a welcome relief to fans that they haven't been dragged into the drawn-out transfer sagas of previous years.

If and when Yoro joins then Ten Hag will have two of Europe's brightest young stars joining after the arrival of Zirkzee. It's a mouthwatering prospect to go alongside other young talent including Mainoo, Garnacho and Hojlund.

But midfield remains a concern as United cannot afford to go a whole season with Casemiro trying to cover spaces which left United's defence exposed on countless occasions last term. The priority now has to be a defensive midfielder with PSG's Manuel Ugarte looking like a player who could fit into their new philosophy under Dan Ashworth and Ineos.
Joao Neves would also be a great signing but the fee required to complete a deal is likely to be beyond United's financial means in this window.

The signings of Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro add to both the front and back line options for Erik ten Hag in the upcoming season, so concentration should be now on completing the spine with a midfield addition.

The uncertainty over the future of Casemiro means that United will be short in the area if he is sold. The team will need a long-term partner for Kobbie Mainoo at the base of midfield, Sofyan Amrabat played the role in the FA Cup final but has since turned to Fiorentina.
Manuel Ugarte has been linked with a move to Old Trafford and could be the solution. At just 23-years old he is still young, meaning that the position could be sorted for years to come.
He is said to be available for around £38 million which could prove to be a shrewd long-term investment in midfield.

body: Reports coming out of Italy have said that Man United could be an option for Adrien Rabiot in this summer's transfer window.

Manchester United's search for a statement signing in midfield in the 2022 summer transfer window was a saga that is unlikely to be forgotten anytime soon.

After pinning all of their hopes on signing Barcelona ace Frenkie de Jong, United, in the end, were forced to look elsewhere to finish constructing Erik ten Hag's new-look midfield. It was a saga that ran and ran but brought De Jong nowhere close to Old Trafford.

Eventually, of course, United settled on Casemiro, drafting him in just over a week after the infamous 4-0 stuffing at Brentford. Some considered it as a knee-jerk reaction because of the contrasting differences in the profiles of the two players.

However, United needed a world-class defensive-midfielder and Casemiro was exactly that, joining the club from Real Madrid for an initial fee of £60million. But in between calling time on their pursuit of De Jong and Casemiro being presented to the Old Trafford faithful just minutes before the 2-1 win over Liverpool, United attempted to bring Adrien Rabiot to M16.

United agreed a deal in principle with Juventus to sign the French international in a package that could have been worth up to £20m. However, the Reds were forced to abandon their pursuit of the former Paris Saint-Germain ace because of his wage demands.
Sources at the time said Rabiot wanted an 'obscene' salary. His mother, Veronique, is his agent and negotiated on his behalf.

Almost two years on since United abandoned their pursuit of the 29-year-old, they are being linked with his signature once again. He is currently available as a free agent after his contract expired at Juventus last month.

A report coming out of Italy on Thursday morning claimed Rabiot is now open to holding 'discussions' with clubs about the next chapter in his career, including United. The Old Trafford outfit are on the hunt for fresh blood in midfield this summer, specifically a defensive-minded operator.

United have already wrapped up the signing of Bologna forward Joshua Zirkzee and are closing in on Lille defender Leny Yoro, meaning further additions could rest on outgoings. They are continuing to be strongly linked with PSG's Manuel Ugarte as far as their pursuit of a new midfielder is concerned.

However, the fact Rabiot is currently without a club and is available for free could tempt United to rekindle their interest in his services. Still south of 30, he would represent a solid addition for a lot of clubs on a free transfer.

Amid suggestions he could enter talks with United, Rabiot has previously admitted he would like to experience playing in the Premier League. He made the admission while on international duty at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.
"It was very good experience," said Rabiot, answering a question about his time in England with Manchester City's academy in 2008. "I didn't do a whole season, though.
"Everything went well while I was there. I really liked the atmosphere. It's really something that is only in England. It's different from France and Italy.
"I have always said that I'd like to play in England in my career. I still have that desire. I'd like to evolve in the Premier League."
On the Premier League, he added: "I haven't got a Premier League team in mind right now. I haven't chosen a team or anything. It's a general thing.
"It's the league, it's the level of play that's going on, that's what attracts me most. It corresponds to my qualities."

At senior level, Rabiot has experienced playing in both France and Italy, meaning he may be tempted to test himself in England for the first time. He has certainly not closed the door on that possibility.

headline: Brutal Erik ten Hag comments raise Manchester United stakes ahead of crisis club meeting
body: Man Utd started their pre-season campaign with a whimper in Norway but they will face a much more competitive outing in Scotland this weekend.

After slamming Manchester United's performance against Rosenborg on Monday night, Erik ten Hag insisted he knew why things had gone wrong at Lerkendal stadium.

"Oh, yeah, of course, but it's so many whys," he said. "I can give all the reasons that we have to do better. The fans and everyone around us is expecting us to win and definitely give a performance but we didn't succeed."

'So many whys' isn't exactly a phrase that will put everyone at ease after United stumbled into a pre-season campaign that Ten Hag needs to get right. His criticism of the display in Norway has put some pressure on fixtures that usually come without that kind of burden.
"Not good enough," was Ten Hag's snap reaction to the late defeat. "This is not the standard for top football. Top football, you have to achieve much higher standards."

It was a brutal appraisal of a game where the result had felt secondary and the performance only a little more important. The first friendly of the summer, with such a callow squad, is about building up match fitness. It was always going to be a tough test against a team midway through their league season and United's players felt they were flagging and being overrun in the final 10 minutes of the first half.

Nobody in attendance was reading too much into what had happened on the pitch until Ten Hag took aim at his squad and made his demands for standards to be met. It was his first game since the FA Cup final, since surviving a brush with the sack, and perhaps this was an attempt to send a message to Ineos as much as it was his players. Omar Berrada, Dan Ashworth and Jason Wilcox were all in attendance.

What the comments have done is raise the stakes for pre-season. This was only a friendly but United again allowed 22 shots at their goal. Radek Vitek was their best player by a long distance. If United open the competitive season by continuing to allow teams so many shots it will spell trouble for Ten Hag.

So rather than the next four games being about a gradual rise to match sharpness ahead of the Community Shield on August 10 and Fulham at Old Trafford on August 16, it is now also about delivering some performances, starting this weekend.

On Saturday United face a 'Battle of Britain' fixture against Rangers at Murrayfield. The hosts won't be taking this contest lightly and, as their only friendly in Scotland, they could receive plenty of backing as well - even if the fixture is in Edinburgh rather than Glasgow.

United return to Scotland's home of rugby for the second summer in a row with Ibrox out of action due to the redevelopment of the Copeland Road stand. A delay in that work means they are unlikely to be back at their home for another three months or so.

That adds to the feeling of at least a mini-crisis around Rangers. Their season begins in two weeks and they have Champions League qualifiers to aim for as well, but Philippe Clement wants more quality in his squad. Rangers must sell to buy and a clear-out of players is proving difficult.

As the Ibrox Noise website said ahead of this fixture: "Rangers aren’t in a good place right now, we could be as bold and maybe fatalistic to say it’s the worst place our club has been since 2018 and the early fledgling Steven Gerrard days – it’s certainly by far the worst preseason we’ve had for many years."
